title: 3 Easy Ways to Check if Uber is Available in Your Area with the Website and the Mobile App

steps.title: Go to https://www.uber.com/global/en/price-estimate in your web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.uber.com/global/en/price-estimate in your web browser. This is the easiest way to see if you can take an Uber to your destination without having to download the Uber app. You can use any web browser on your computer, Android, iPhone, or iPad to view this page without an account.

steps.title: Enter a pickup location and destination.
steps.content: Enter a pickup location and destination. You'll get suggestions under each bar that you can click instead of typing the full address. [1] X Research source Once you enter the two locations, the tool will estimate your totals. If Uber isn't available in your pickup location, you'll get an error that says, "Sorry, a price estimate is not available right now." In that case, your best bet might be to hail a cab.

steps.title: Click Request a Ride (if you see a quote).
steps.content: Click Request a Ride (if you see a quote). You may get a glitch that shows you the prices of that trip even though Uber does not pick up in a specific location. Clicking this is the only way you can make sure the ride is available. [2] X Research source If you're not signed in, you'll be prompted to sign in to continue. If this is a glitch, you'll see an error message that "The pickup location you entered is outside Uber's service area and you'll most likely want to hail a cab for a ride. Tap Schedule for Later if you want to take that ride later. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://www.uber.com/cities in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.uber.com/cities in a web browser. This page lists all the cities where Uber is available. However, not all cities are listed individually. [4] X Research source For example, Long Beach and Burbank aren't listed individually, but are included within the Los Angeles market. So, even though your city may not be listed, it might be included in the closest city's market.

steps.title: Click a city.
steps.content: Click a city. You'll see on the next page that the city you've picked is shown on a map with an outline of that market's availability. If you live in or are traveling around Memphis, for example, you can get a ride to Forrest City, Arkansas even though that city is not listed on its own on the previous page. If Uber is not available in your area, you can try to hail a cab.

steps.title: Download and open Uber from the App Store or Play Store.
steps.content: Download and open Uber from the App Store or Play Store . Tap Get or Install , and then Open once the installation completes.

steps.title: Tap Get Started.
steps.content: Tap Get Started . You'll see this at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Create an account.
steps.content: Create an account. You can sign up for Uber by entering your phone number into the top field and selecting Continue. [5] X Research source Alternatively, you can select Continue with Google , Continue with Apple , or Continue with Facebook to instantly create an account using your information from any of these services.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to register for Uber.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to register for Uber. Once you verify your phone number and enter a payment method, you'll be able to see which Uber options, if any, are available in your area. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Where to?.
steps.content: Tap Where to? . This opens the Plan Your Ride screen, where you can request a ride to a supported location.

steps.title: Select your location and destination.
steps.content: Select your location and destination. Tap the first menu and enter the address of where you are now. Then, tap the second field and enter your destination. If Uber is available from your current location to this destination, you'll be able to select one of Uber's car types (e.g., UberX or UberXL.). [7] X Research source If no service is available, you'll see "No Cars Available." uberX is the standard Uber service, while uberXL is a larger car and Black is for luxury vehicles. You can drag the pin around to change your pickup location and time estimate will adjust accordingly. Nearby cars will be displayed on the map and their current location will update every few seconds.
